page.title: 02BARNARD CASTLE-HISTORIC TOWN
page.content: In 1964 Barnard Castle was among 51 towns listed as being of outstanding quality,worthy of preservation as part of the national heritage.Many buildings are of yellow sandstone with Teesdale slate roofs.Grants help with the high cost of repairing such roofs.The Civic Society has renovated and resold some old buildings.Barnard Castle has many old lanes and yards, some in need of repair. Too much heavy traffic on the A67 goes through the town. At times the main street is overloaded with cars. The traffic causes noise,fumes,parking problems and building damage.Heavy traffic has been diverted from the mediaeval bridge to another historic bridge. This now has to be closed for 3months.Is a new bridge or a bypass the answer?Is there a suitable site for a new bridge?
